landmark-one-main:
A main landmark is a way to identify the primary content area of a web page, making it easier for assistive technologies like screen readers to navigate the page. To ensure a document has a main landmark, you can use the HTML5 `
` element or use ARIA roles. Here's an example of how to use the `
` element: ```html Example Page with Main Landmark

Primary Content Heading

This is the main content of the page. All the primary content should be placed inside the main element to ensure it's identified as the main landmark.

``` In the example above, the `
` element is used to wrap the primary content of the page, ensuring that the document has a main landmark. Alternatively, you can use the ARIA `role` attribute with the value "main" to achieve the same result: ```html

Primary Content Heading

This is the main content of the page. All the primary content should be placed inside the element with the role="main" attribute to ensure it's identified as the main landmark.

``` Note that using the `
` element is recommended, as it provides better semantics and is more widely supported by assistive technologies. However, the ARIA `role` attribute can be used as a fallback when the `
` element is not available or supported.
